Key Match Events: Virat Kohli hit an unbeaten 82 to lead India to a four-wicket victory over Pakistan.
Kohli hit three sixes in the final eight balls to secure the win.
Arshdeep Singh took 3-32 in his four overs, removing both Pakistan openers early.
Iftikhar Ahmed scored 51 off 34 balls for Pakistan.
Shan Masood's half-century helped Pakistan reach a competitive total.
Hardik Pandya and Virat Kohli's 113-run partnership for the fifth wicket was crucial for India's chase.
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expressed disbelief and joy at the victory, calling it a very special moment.
Kohli compared his innings to his previous best against Australia, stating this one was higher due to the game's magnitude.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in front of a capacity crowd of 90,293 at the MCG.
The crowd's enthusiasm contributed significantly to the atmosphere of the match.
